definition: to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Cox Report/Report of the Select Committee on US National Security and Military-Commercial Concerns with the PRC (1999); Committee Chairman Republican Rep. Chris Cox

sentences.english: Yet according to Cox, yttrium was not even listed in the report.
sentences.chinese: 但根据考克斯的说法，钇甚至没被列入这份报告之中。

sentences.english: Piet the other 6 points, 4 points Wilcox, Bangyan only 2 points.
sentences.chinese: 对方皮特罗6分，威尔考克斯4分，榜眼只得到2分。

sentences.english: It often comes at the expense of what Ms.Cox calls social and financial education.
sentences.chinese: 这往往会以考克斯女士所说的社会与资金教育为代价。

sentences.english: The new policies have led to rapid economic development.
sentences.chinese: 考克斯和阿尔姆写道，新的政策导致经济迅速发展。

sentences.english: Cox Cable false advertising double-billing scam in Las Vegas, New York.
sentences.chinese: 考克斯有线双计费虚假广告诈骗拉斯维加斯，新建。

sentences.english: Cox and others propose to strengthen the control over the export of computers to other countries.
sentences.chinese: 考克斯等人提出要加强对其它国家计算机出口的控制。

sentences.english: Cox and others, however, intentionally over-emphasize the use of computers in the military field.
sentences.chinese: 但考克斯等人有意过份强调计算机在军事方面的用途。

sentences.english: The coxes were wondering last night whether she would get into any great family.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，考克斯姐妹寻思着，她会不会去哪个上流人家。
皮特威尔考克斯是船长。

sentences.english: Cox and others seemed to be quite meticulous in writing this lengthy report.
sentences.chinese: 考克斯等人数万言的报告似乎作得很细。

definition: Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
Burns (name)/Nicholas Burns (1956-), US diplomat, Under-secretary at US State Department from 2005
